alert.note: Alert for Aguas Buenas; Barranquitas; Ciales; Cidra; Comerio; Corozal; Morovis; Naranjito; Orocovis (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 11:43PM ADT until September 19 at 6:30AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Aguas Buenas County in Puerto Rico... Barranquitas County in Puerto Rico... Ciales County in Puerto Rico... Cidra County in Puerto Rico... Comerio County in Puerto Rico... Corozal County in Puerto Rico... Morovis County in Puerto Rico... Naranjito County in Puerto Rico... Orocovis County in Puerto Rico... * Until 530 AM AST Monday. * At 1043 PM AST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 4 and 15 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1.5 inches per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 6 inches are possible in the warned area due to the passage of another hurricane rainband. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of mainstem rivers including Rio Grande de Manati and Rio Corozal, creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Rio Corozal is out of its banks on road 891 in front of the police station. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Aguas Buenas; Barranquitas; Ciales; Cidra; Comerio; Corozal; Morovis; Naranjito; Orocovis
